alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 6:33PM MST until July 29 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NAVAJO COUNTY... At 633 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain had ended across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Joseph City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 273 and 280. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 276. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Wash, Manila Wash, Little Colorado River, Joseph City Wash, Tanner Wash, Mesa Wash, Blairs Spring Wash, Billy Wash and Leroux Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
